intro: Hieracium caesiopsis, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows and grassy areas. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to blue or purple, depending on the variety. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and are covered in fine hairs. Hieracium caesiopsis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
